intro: Retinispora recurvata, commonly known as the zigzag vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its twisting, serpentine growth habit and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Retinispora recurvata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
